1761757001395-969621185-IPS Internship J.content:
--- Page 1 ---
Position — Intern (IPS Team)
Informatica is the only Enterprise Cloud Data Management leader that accelerates data-driven
digital transformation. Informatica enables companies to unleash the power of data to become
more agile, realize new growth opportunities, lead to new inventions resulting in intelligent market
disruptions.
With over 10,000 customers worldwide, Informatica is the trusted leader in Enterprise Cloud Data
Management. Your Opportunity: Imagine yourself working for the leading independent software
provider focused on delivering transformative innovation for the future of all things data.
Organizations around the world rely on Informatica to realize their information potential and drive
top business imperatives. As a University Graduate at Informatica, you will be exposed to innovative
culture, challenging work and a fast moving, results oriented environment.
Informatica Professional Services(IPS),youwillprovide product expertise and data management
knowledge to deliver the most architecturally efficient and cost-effective solution for our customer’s
data integration projects. The Consultant will work closely with the customer, other Informatica
consultants and customer/partner resources, Sales, Global Customer Support and Product
Management to ensure customer’s success and satisfaction with our products and services and
contribute to their long-term loyalty. The successful candidate will drive the Informatica Data Quality
implementations. Working either independently, with or within a team, you will have the
opportunity to work at the front end in a rapidly growing business. Our Ideal Candidate: You are a
technology savvy IT professional who strives for excellence and is known as a trusted advisor to the
customer. You possess superb communication and customer-relationship skills and are comfortable
working both independently and collaboratively. You’re advanced problem solving skills and
Technical aptitudes allow you to adapt to new circumstances and learn quickly when facing new
problems and challenges.
Applying your superior business acumen and resource management skills you meet deadlines and
set the example for good work procedures.
In addition to the attributes mentioned, you’ll also be able to: - Adapt to customer’s work culture
and establish an excellent working relationship with them - Demonstrate a strong desire to grow
both technically and as a trusted advisor to the customer.
Your Responsibilities Deliver solutions per Velocity methodology:
1. Document and review requirements, technical specifications, and customer expectations
2. Design the solution.
3. Build the solution per specifications and customer expectations.
4. Execute test plan and document results; debug solution as required.
5. Document solution using Velocity templates.
Contribute to team solution implementation:
1. As amember of the team, apply technical skills to the solution.
2. Implement the solution based on project lead’s guidance.
3. Communicate project status to project lead.

--- Page 2 ---
4. Ensure that features of the solutionare correctly and consistently implemented.

On-going skills development:

1. Identify skill development needs and training plan.

2. Shadow experienced consultants on client sites to gain knowledge ,skills and experience.

3. Contribute to Velocity Knowledge Base, weekly calls.

4. Identify and attend formal training classes.

5. Demonstrate self-sufficiency in problems solving and knowledge acquisition from resources
throughout the company. Additional Information: Informatica offers a competitive compensation
package that includes base salary, medical, tax benefits and more.

Our generous benefits vary depending on your geographic work location. It’s an exciting time to
work at Informatica. You can learn more about our company, our products and our services at
www.informatica.com.We are an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE)

Profile Summary
Computer Science undergrad with strong foundations in C, C++, Java, and data structures. Experienced in building web
applications using React and Node.js, and working with MongoDB/MySQL. Collaborated in team projects to design and
develop functioning web applications.

eo Databases: MongoDB, MySQL

Internship Experience
Full Stack Developer Intern                                     PANDAeCe, Bangalore — Oct 2024 - Dec 2024
© Assisted in building PANDAeCe’s official website using React.js and Node.js, improving overall performance.
o Learned full-stack web development technologies and gained practical experience through client projects.
o Contributed to building complete web solutions as per client requirements, improving development skills.
Projects
EquiChain — AI + Blockchain Scheme Verification «= ©. Demo
© Built an Al-powered document verification platform to extract and validate unstructured data, storing results on blockchain.
° Stack: React.js, Node.js, MongoDB, Ethereum (Sepolia), Web3.js, Gemini API, Azure OCR
o Impact: Automated the verification workflow, reducing manual processing time and preventing fraudulent entries through
on-chain validation.
Track Wise — Collaborative Study Platform                                                                  Demo
o Developed a study platform with a dashboard for managing notes, schedules, and tasks, featuring a chatbot for queries
and collaborative rooms with Pomodoro timer, whiteboard, and video calls.

o Impact: Built an interactive study platform used by my friends to make study sessions more engaging and collaborative.
Motion Following Rover — Integrated Camera and GPS                                                Demo Video

© Tech Stack: Arduino Uno, ESP8266 NodeMCU, ESP32-CAM, NEO-6M GPS, Ultrasonic Sensor, IR Sensors
o Impact: Provided an IoT-robotics solution that assists in defense logistics, supply transport, and remote surveillance.

o Winner — DevTrack Project Cycle: Led a team to build StudySphere and won the competition among 20 teams.

1761819394627-445952368-Alpha Aptitude c.content:
ALPHA APTITUDE CHEATCODE by Nandhini Raja
1min/question should be the speed to aim since the number of questions will be generally framed in that way. Basic math tricks are very imp to get the speed.
To Prepare for Placements in 3months - 
https://curiousfreakss.com/
Watch this video to learn the basic math tricks to get to this speed and to use this sheet efficiently- 
Master Aptitude😳Blueprint to CRACK APTITUDE like PRO🔥
Follow our channel for coding & Career videos - 
https://www.youtube.com/@curiousfreaks_/videos
Categories in Aptitude Round:
Arithmetic
Verbal
Reasoning
Programming
Quantitative Aptitude Topics:
Average
Time & Distance
Time & Work
HCF & LCM
Train
Ages
Profit & Loss
Permutations & Combinations
Ratio & Proportion
Area
Simple Interest & Compound Interest
Probability
Pipes & Cisterns
Discount
Clocks & Calendars
Height and Distance
Volume & Surface
Percentage
Reasoning
Analytical
Puzzles
Blood Relations
Directions
Seating Arrangements
Logical -
Syllogisms
Logical connectives
Assumptions & Conclusions
Cause & Effect
Series completion
Odd one out
Verbal
Jumbled sentence
Passange comprehension
Spotting errors
Sentence formation
Data Sufficiency - Evaluating is the provided data is enough to answer the question.
Aptitude topic patterns
Average
Type 1 : Average of Numbers
Type 2: Average of weight / age / marks of two or more groups / classes.
Type 3: Change in average when one entry is added/replaced.
Type 4 : Change in average when one entry is entered wrong.
Type 5 : Average speed
Type 6: Cricket/Scores/Innings
Learn the patterns - 
https://www.careerride.com/average.aspx
 
Practice the topic - 
https://www.indiabix.com/aptitude/average/
 
Video tutorial - 
https://youtu.be/rhSxQ4ieAYc?si=BqHz6Oi0lGxSNg6F
Time & Distance
Type 1: Calculate either time, speed or distance from the other two given parameters.
Type 2: Calculate speed of two people moving between two points, A and B, in opposite directions & crossing each other on the way.
Type 3: Finding Relative Speed for two bodies moving in same or opposite directions.
Type 4: Numericals on Average Speed when the same part of total distance is traveled at two or more different speeds.
Learn the Patterns - 
https://www.careerride.com/time-and-distance-aptitude-test.aspx
Practice questions - 
https://www.indiabix.com/aptitude/time-and-distance/
Video tutorial - 
https://youtu.be/jzNxXm5twx4?si=xfeKhJSIriwFxydv
Time & Work
Type 1: Efficiency of two or more workers is give separately. Find how much time would they take to finish the work together.
Type 2: Find the time required to complete the work
by one worker if the total time taken by all workers and one of the workers are given.
either alone or together by the workers for the given times of workers in combined form.
Type 3: Find the time required
to complete the work together if one worker is 'm' times as efficient as the other worker & takes 'D' days less than the other worker
to complete the work by one of the workers if they work together or if work efficiencies of two workers are given.
Type 4: Calculate the time required by men or (combination of men with other people) to complete a certain work in certain hours for the given another set of number of required men, work & hours.
Learn the topics from - 
https://www.careerride.com/time-and-work-aptitude-test.aspx
Practice questions - 
https://www.indiabix.com/aptitude/time-and-work/
Video tutorial - 
https://youtu.be/KE7tQf9spPg?si=D_Wlnt4wm3zwtowR
HCF & LCM
Type 1: Find H.C.F. and L.C.M of composite numbers
Type 2: Find H.C.F. and L.C.M. of decimal numbers and fractions
Type 3: Find the numbers/sum of numbers/product of numbers if
1) Their ratio and H.C.F. are given.
2) Product of H.C.F. and L.C.M are given.
Type 4: Find the least number, which when divided by another number leaves a remainder.
Type 5: Application based numerical of H.C.F. and L.C.M.
Learn the topics from - 
https://www.careerride.com/problems-on-H.C.F-and-L.C.M-
 
aptitude-test.aspx
Practice questions - 
https://www.indiabix.com/aptitude/problems-on-hcf-and-lcm/
Video tutorial - 
https://youtu.be/xyyejJYeILM?si=6fPYbBjI3ULIFMQA
Train
Type 1 : I) A train crosses a stationary object on the platform. Find
the time taken or
length of train
Type 2 : I) A train of given length crosses the platform at a given speed. Find:
Time taken to cross the platform or
Length of platform
Type 3: Find time taken by a train to cross a person running in opposite direction at a given speed.
Type 4: Find time taken by a train to cross a person running in same direction at a given speed.
Type 5: Find time taken by two trains moving in opposite direction at given speed, to cross each other
Type 6: Two trains move at a given speed in same direction. Find:
Time taken to cross each other
Length of train
Learn the topic - 
https://www.careerride.com/problems-on-trains-aptitude-test.aspx
Practice questions - 
https://www.indiabix.com/aptitude/problems-on-trains/
Video tutorial - 
https://youtu.be/78b4Jn4rw44?si=F5tO9Rk-La5Dpk2b
Ages
Type1: Calculate Present age
Type 2: Numerical to Determine Ages in ratio form
Type 3: Numerical to Determine Age of a Person before x Years
Type 4: Numericals to Determine Age of a Person after x Years
Learn the topic - 
https://www.careerride.com/problem-on-ages.aspx
Practice questions - 
https://www.indiabix.com/aptitude/problems-on-ages/
Video tutorial - 
https://youtu.be/tJHl73PBnwY?si=cvF4d79ycjuowowV
Profit & Loss
Type 1: To find Profit/Loss or Selling Price/Cost Price.
Type 2: Calculate profit/loss If cost price of X articles is equal to selling price of Y articles. (C.P. of X articles = S.P. of Y articles)
Type 3: Find loss incurred by the shopkeeper
Material A sold at x % gain and material B sold at x % loss.
Material A sold at x % gain and material B sold at y % loss.
Type 4: Trader sells goods at cost price but uses a weight of x kg instead of y kg (false weights) and makes profit. Calculate profit.
Type 5: Numerical on Discount and Successive discounts/profit
Learn the topic - 
https://www.careerride.com/profit-and-loss-aptitude-test.aspx
Practice the topic - 
https://www.indiabix.com/aptitude/profit-and-loss/
Video tutorial - 
https://youtu.be/T2odvmxqi1I?si=kkveC3Yrc39fI4x3
Ratio & Proportion
Type 1: Proportion
Type 2: Division and Distribution of objects into ratios
Type 3: Mixture of different contents
Type 4: Income/ Expenditure and Salary
Type 5: Coins and Values
Learn the topic - 
https://www.careerride.com/ratio-and-proportion-aptitude-test.aspx
Practice the topic -
 https://www.indiabix.com/aptitude/ratio-and-proportion/
 
Video tutorial - 
https://youtu.be/jfoJBivWlnQ?si=zQcDJI4wX3R035hW
Permutation & Combination
Type 1: Direct Permutation
Type 2: Direct Combination
Learn the topic - 
https://www.careerride.com/permutations-and-combinations.aspx
 
Practice the topic - 
https://www.indiabix.com/aptitude/permutation-and-combination/
 
Video tutorial -
Probability
Probability given direct values with indirect statement
Probability given indirect values
Learn the topic - 
https://www.careerride.com/probability.aspx
Practice the topic - 
https://www.indiabix.com/aptitude/probability/
Video tutorial - 
https://youtu.be/ximxxERGSUc?si=7L5Qqqv4-1PCuqNI
Pipes & Cisterns
Type 1: Find the time to fill/ empty the tank by the pipes together for the given time of individual pipes.
Type 2: Find the capacity of tank for given
time of each pipe to fill up a tank if they work alone and
rate at which outlet pipe can empty the tank.
Type 3: Find the time taken by leak to empty the tank for given
a. a) time of pipe to fill a tank &
b) time taken by leak to fill the tank due to leakage.
Type 4:
Find the time taken by two pipes to fill the tank if they work individually if it is given that -
one pipe is 'm' times faster/slower than another pipe and
time taken by two pipes to fill the tank together.
ii) Find the time taken to fill an empty tank for given -
time of each pipe to fill the tank separately and
one of the pipes is full-time working and the other 2 pipes are open for certain hour alternately.
Type 5:
Find the time taken to fill the tank for given -
the time of inlet pipes to fill a tank if they work alone and the outlet pipe to empty a tank &
all pipes are opened but outlet pipe is opened/closed after certain hours
Find the total time required to fill the tank if -
the time of each inlet pipe to fill the tank individually and
all the pipes are opened simultaneously and after certain time, one of the pipes is turned off.
Learn the topic - 
https://www.indiabix.com/aptitude/pipes-and-cistern/
Practice questions - 
https://www.careerride.com/pipes-and-cistern-aptitude-test.aspx
Video tutorial - 
https://youtu.be/mBtBD1N7ywQ?si=wOiRvORbe_I6GueR
Simple Interest
Type 1: Find simple interest
Type 2: Find rate of interest
Type 3: Find principal or amount
Practice questions 
- 
https://www.indiabix.com/aptitude/simple-interest/
Learn the topic - 
https://www.careerride.com/simple-interest-aptitude-test.aspx
Video tutorial - 
https://youtu.be/jvRq87ZWzIk?si=n7oSdSO18R1j8sVn
Compound interest
Type 1: Numerical based on population
Type 2: Numerical to find compound interest (yearly, quarterly, and half-yearly)
Type 3: Numerical to find rate of interest/years
Type 4: Numerical to find sum/rate of interest when difference between C.I. and S.I. is specified
Learn the topic - 
https://www.careerride.com/compound-interest.aspx
Practice questions - 
https://www.indiabix.com/aptitude/compound-interest/
Video tutorial -
 https://youtu.be/PbUZnzncmR4?si=oB-L7a52asCgghMl
Discount
Learn the topic -
 https://www.careerride.com/true-discount.aspx
 
Practice questions - 
https://www.indiabix.com/aptitude/true-discount/
 
Video tutorial -
 
https://youtu.be/FW97hRrHcSw?si=yGw2XTq8JjAj-nPo
Volume & Surface
Learn the topic - 
https://
www.careerride.com/volume-and-surface-area.aspx

12/21/25, 6:39 PM                                                    Conference Management Toolkit - Submission Summary
Submission Summary
Conference Name
2026 International Conference on Innovations in Communication, Geoscience and Robotics
Paper ID
240
Paper Title
Intelligent Cloud Storage Systems: A Comprehensive Survey of Al-powered Search and ML-
based Security Architecture
Abstract
This comprehensive survey paper analyzes the integration of artificial intelligence and machine
learning techniques
in modern cloud storage systems. We systematically review 52 research papers from 2015 to
2024, covering three core aspects: Al powered document processing and OCR technologies,
semantic searchable encryption mechanisms, and machine learning-based security
architectures for cloud storage. The analysis reveals that hybrid deep learning approaches
achieve 99.2% OCR accuracy with 67% cost reduction compared to traditional methods. In
security domains, ensemble models demonstrate 99.3% attack detection rates with only 0.1%
false positives. The survey identifies significant research gaps in cross-modal retrieval, quantum
resistant encryption, and federated learning implementations. We present a novel taxonomy of
intelligent storage systems and propose an architectural framework that integrates vector
databases, serverless computing, and adaptive security models. The paper concludes with
future research directions focusing on privacy-preserving Al, explainable machine learning, and
edge cloud continuum architectures for next-generation intelligent storage solutions.
